com.aloqa.trax.client.saps
Interface Connection_SAP_Target

public interface Connection_SAP_Target

Use this interface to control and check the current connection status to the Aloqa server. Note that the positions of other users can only be accessed, if there is a connection to the server. The interface offers a simple method to control thread allocation in case of user events.

Field Summary
static byte POLICY_NEW_THREAD_FOR_EACH_EVENT
          Represents a policy that creates and runs a new thread for each callback to App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse).

          Represents a policy that uses a simple unbounded thread pool that caches and reuses created threads until a certain time limit.

          Represents a policy that runs each callback to App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse) in the thread of the caller.

 void stopConnection()

Field Detail

POLICY_NEW_THREAD_FOR_EACH_EVENT

static final byte POLICY_NEW_THREAD_FOR_EACH_EVENT
Represents a policy that creates and runs a new thread for each callback to App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse).
This policy is the least efficient, but most robust of all.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

POLICY_SIMPLE_THREAD_POOL

static final byte POLICY_SIMPLE_THREAD_POOL
Represents a policy that uses a simple unbounded thread pool that caches and reuses created threads until a certain time limit. It guarantees that callbacks to App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse) are run in a different thread than IO-tasks. Hence, no deadlocks can occur. However, the thread must never be killed after the method, as is sometimes the case on the Google Android platform. So, use this policy with care on Android!
This policy represents a compromise between efficiency and usability.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

POLICY_SINGLE_THREAD

static final byte POLICY_SINGLE_THREAD
Represents a policy that runs each callback to App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse) in the thread of the caller. As the caller of this method is an IO-responsible task, IO is blocked until App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse) returns. In particular, no further IO-relevant tasks may be conducted in thread that runs the method. Otherwise, a deadlock will occur. For example, if, in the same thread that calls the method App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse), pollings are conducted (by TraXAPI_SAP_App.synchRequest(String, SynchronousRequest)), then the system will block forever!
Note, however, that this policy is the most efficient of all.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

startConnecting

void startConnecting(ConnectionParameters p,
                     byte threadPolicy)
Starts a connection to the Aloqa server. Whenever a disconnection with the server occurs, it will be tried to reconnect after a certain time-out specified by the Aloqa server.

Parameters:
p - The ConnectionParameters for this connection.
threadPolicy - A thread policy that specifies the way callbacks to App_SAP_TraXAPI.update(String, com.aloqa.trax.shared.saps.AsynchronousResponse) are handled cp. POLICY_SIMPLE_THREAD_POOL, POLICY_SINGLE_THREAD, and POLICY_NEW_THREAD_FOR_EACH_EVENT.

stopConnection

void stopConnection()
Closes an open connection to the Aloqa server, if there is one, and stops trying to reconnect.
